name: Synlik
tagline: Synthetic Likelihood methods for intractable likelihoods.
body:
### The *synlik* R package

Synthetic Likelihood (SL) is a statistics methodology, introduced by Wood (2010), which can be used to do inference for models were the likelihood function is unavailable or intractable. SL is a general-purpose methodology in the sense that, as long as the user is able to simulate data from his model, he should be able to fit it. For this reason, the **synlik** R package puts very few limitations on the model being fitted: the user has simply to provide a simulator and (optionally) a function that transforms that data into summary statistics. 

The packages has been written with attention to computational efficiency and most of the functions provided by the package supports computation on multiple cores. At the moment **synlik** includes a set of simple, but useful and well documented statistical tools. In the future the package will be often updated and improved by the addition of new statistical methods and tools.

To check what **synlik** does, download of install it from here or from CRAN and have a look at its vignette:
```
library("synlik")
vignette("synlik")
``` 

### Authors
Matteo Fasiolo (@Jugurtha) and Simon Wood.

### References
* Matteo Fasiolo, Simon Wood. An introduction to synlik (2014). R package version 0.1.0.
* Simon N Wood. Statistical inference for noisy nonlinear ecological dynamic systems. Nature, 466(7310):1102--1104, 2010.

### Support or Contact
To report bugs or the suggest new features, please contact me at matteo_DOT_fasiolo_AT_gmail.com.
